meanings.definition: The act of lacking or being without something.
meanings.sent1: Her lakings of sleep made her feel tired all day.
meanings.sent2: The lakings of food in the pantry made cooking dinner a challenge.
meanings.sent3: His lakings of patience were evident when he snapped at his friend for no reason.
meanings.sent4: The lakings of sunshine on the rainy day made everything seem gloomy.
meanings.sent5: The lakings of laughter in the room made it feel empty and quiet.

meanings.definition: The state of not having enough of something.
meanings.sent1: The lakings of time prevented her from finishing the project.
meanings.sent2: His lakings of money made it difficult to pay the bills.
meanings.sent3: The lakings of snacks in the pantry led to a hilarious search for hidden treats.
meanings.sent4: Her lakings of courage held her back from trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The lakings of water in the desert left them feeling desperate and thirsty.

meanings.definition: To be deficient or missing in something.
meanings.sent1: She lakings the necessary skills to complete the task.
meanings.sent2: He lakings the confidence to speak in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat lakings interest in the new toy and prefers the old one.
meanings.sent4: The old house lakings modern amenities like central heating.
meanings.sent5: The garden lakings colorful flowers, making it look dull and plain.
